meanings.definition: To retire or become ineligible for active duty due to old age or infirmity.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather superannuates from his job last year.
meanings.sent2: After many years of service, the teacher superannuates and enjoys a peaceful retirement.
meanings.sent3: The old dog superannuates from chasing squirrels and now prefers napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: As the seasons change, the leaves superannuate from the trees, preparing for winter.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out shoes superannuate from daily use, ready to be replaced.

meanings.definition: A person who has retired or become ineligible for active duty due to old age or infirmity.
meanings.sent1: The superannuate spends his days gardening and reading.
meanings.sent2: In the retirement home, many superannuates gather for afternoon tea.
meanings.sent3: The superannuate at the park tells stories of the good old days to children.
meanings.sent4: The wise superannuate is a source of guidance for the younger generation.
meanings.sent5: The community honors the superannuate for their years of service and dedication.
